MONL.content: necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself
MONL.linkedContent: necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself

S.content: “I shall speak of ghost, of flame, and of ashes (je parlerai du revenant, de la flamme et des cendres)”
S.linkedContent: “I shall speak of ghost, of flame, and of ashes (je parlerai du revenant, de la flamme et des cendres)”

S.content: Geist is always haunted by its Geist, a ghost is always the other’s ventriloquist; metaphysics always returns, in the sense of a revenant, Geist is the most fatal figure of revenance: the double which can never be separated from the single
S.linkedContent: Geist is always haunted by its Geist, a ghost is always the other’s ventriloquist; metaphysics always returns, in the sense of a revenant, Geist is the most fatal figure of revenance: the double which can never be separated from the single

S.content: spirit as a revenant, founds history as breath of something it cannot name, return to what is to-come in Hölderlin, the poet must preserve this experience in his Gemüt
S.linkedContent: spirit as a revenant, founds history as breath of something it cannot name, return to what is to-come in Hölderlin, the poet must preserve this experience in his Gemüt

S.content: Heidegger interprets der Wahnsinnige in Trakl to mean that the stranger is on the way to elsewhere (as madness, de-ceased, toward the unborn, Artaud’s in-nate)—like a revenant, Derrida adds
S.linkedContent: Heidegger interprets der Wahnsinnige in Trakl to mean that the stranger is on the way to elsewhere (as madness, de-ceased, toward the unborn, Artaud’s in-nate)—like a revenant, Derrida adds

S.content: Derrida uses revenant to describe a Heideggerian passage on Trakl in spite of the metaphysical negativity Heidegger might reject in it: re-venir as the idea of an end before a beginning, originary essence of time kept under veil, guarded in its archi-origin > we are still prisoners of Aristotelian representation of time
S.linkedContent: Derrida uses revenant to describe a Heideggerian passage on Trakl in spite of the metaphysical negativity Heidegger might reject in it: re-venir as the idea of an end before a beginning, originary essence of time kept under veil, guarded in its archi-origin > we are still prisoners of Aristotelian representation of time

S.content: promise (Versprechen) announces, salutes, what has already taken place “before” (this is the temporality of the coming of the event, Ereignis or Geschehen), it is the dissymmetry of a yes before opposition of yes and no, before question, language always revient à de la promesse
S.linkedContent: promise (Versprechen) announces, salutes, what has already taken place “before” (this is the temporality of the coming of the event, Ereignis or Geschehen), it is the dissymmetry of a yes before opposition of yes and no, before question, language always revient à de la promesse

LOBL.content: sur, “on”, the entire enigma of “supplementary logic” [cf. GLAS p. 81r “sur” vs. “dans”]
LOBL.linkedContent: sur, “on”, the entire enigma of “supplementary logic” [cf. GLAS p. 81r “sur” vs. “dans”]

LOBL.content: survival & revenance, living on & returning from the dead: goes beyond life and death, supplementing each w/ sudden surge, a reprieve
LOBL.linkedContent: survival & revenance, living on & returning from the dead: goes beyond life and death, supplementing each w/ sudden surge, a reprieve

LOBL.content: living on as phantom revenance (one who lives on is always a ghost), this is re-markable
LOBL.linkedContent: living on as phantom revenance (one who lives on is always a ghost), this is re-markable

SPOM.content: as soon as one no longer distinguishes spirit from specter, the former assumes a body, incarnates itself, as spirit, in specter > specter an instant of flesh and phenomenality, apparition
SPOM.linkedContent: as soon as one no longer distinguishes spirit from specter, the former assumes a body, incarnates itself, as spirit, in specter > specter an instant of flesh and phenomenality, apparition

SPOM.content: flesh disappears in the apparition, dans la venue même du revenant ou le retour du spectre
SPOM.linkedContent: flesh disappears in the apparition, dans la venue même du revenant ou le retour du spectre

SPOM.content: question of repetition, specter is always a revenant, can’t control its comings and goings > commence par revenir
SPOM.linkedContent: question of repetition, specter is always a revenant, can’t control its comings and goings > commence par revenir

SPOM.content: memories don’t recognize borders btwn ghosts of different generations, revenants pass through walls
SPOM.linkedContent: memories don’t recognize borders btwn ghosts of different generations, revenants pass through walls

SPOM.content: speculation (the hoarder) is always fascinated, bewitched by the specter, devoted in his alchemy to haunting or return of revenants
SPOM.linkedContent: speculation (the hoarder) is always fascinated, bewitched by the specter, devoted in his alchemy to haunting or return of revenants

SPOM.content: spectacularizing speculation, theatricalization of speech, no shut-eye > so intent to watch the return (à guetter la retour) [on imaginary screen]
SPOM.linkedContent: spectacularizing speculation, theatricalization of speech, no shut-eye > so intent to watch the return (à guetter la retour) [on imaginary screen]

SPOM.content: “I am” = “I am haunted,” Ego = ghost; Es Spukt (translation misses impersonal, quasi-anonymity of German), “it spooks,” “it ghosts,” it specters,” ego inhabited by its own specter
SPOM.linkedContent: “I am” = “I am haunted,” Ego = ghost; Es Spukt (translation misses impersonal, quasi-anonymity of German), “it spooks,” “it ghosts,” it specters,” ego inhabited by its own specter

SPOM.content: “es spukt” in Freud’s “Das Unheimliche,” production of figure the revenant (der Spuk)
SPOM.linkedContent: “es spukt” in Freud’s “Das Unheimliche,” production of figure the revenant (der Spuk)

SPOM.content: in German Ideology, Marx’s 10 ghosts (revenants, Gespenst), ils se suppléent pour passer tour à tour l’un dans l’autre, chacun figurant un tour de l’autre: 1) God 2) Das Wesen 3) vanity of world 4) die guten und bösen Wesen 5) das Wesen und sein Reich 6) beings 7) Man-God, Christ 8) man 9) spirit of the people (Volksgeist) 10) everything (“Alles” in ein Spuk zu verwandeln), thus, we must stop counting
SPOM.linkedContent: in German Ideology, Marx’s 10 ghosts (revenants, Gespenst), ils se suppléent pour passer tour à tour l’un dans l’autre, chacun figurant un tour de l’autre: 1) God 2) Das Wesen 3) vanity of world 4) die guten und bösen Wesen 5) das Wesen und sein Reich 6) beings 7) Man-God, Christ 8) man 9) spirit of the people (Volksgeist) 10) everything (“Alles” in ein Spuk zu verwandeln), thus, we must stop counting

SPOM.content: ghosts and mortals can put the dead to rest, the dead cannot, it is impossible “and they must not do so,” this impossibility, the dead putting dead to rest [p. 31 “do not reduce testimony to knowledge”?], can take place, it is the ruin or the absolute ashes, it is total presence, absolute evil, Derrida exorcises, not to chase but to grant ghosts the right to return (faire droit), revenant
SPOM.linkedContent: ghosts and mortals can put the dead to rest, the dead cannot, it is impossible “and they must not do so,” this impossibility, the dead putting dead to rest [p. 31 “do not reduce testimony to knowledge”?], can take place, it is the ruin or the absolute ashes, it is total presence, absolute evil, Derrida exorcises, not to chase but to grant ghosts the right to return (faire droit), revenant

MPM.content: ghosts always pass quickly, infinite speed, presence w/out present that in coming back only haunts > the ghost, le re-venant, the survivor, figure or fiction, presence w/out presence, instant w/out duration, not nothing
MPM.linkedContent: ghosts always pass quickly, infinite speed, presence w/out present that in coming back only haunts > the ghost, le re-venant, the survivor, figure or fiction, presence w/out presence, instant w/out duration, not nothing

POOF.content: via Cicero, the friend as exemplary, illuminates, brings hope beyond death, elle la promet à la revenance testamentaire d'un plus-dé vie, d'un survivre qui restera ici l'un de nos thèmes
POOF.linkedContent: via Cicero, the friend as exemplary, illuminates, brings hope beyond death, elle la promet à la revenance testamentaire d'un plus-dé vie, d'un survivre qui restera ici l'un de nos thèmes

A.content: border of absolute arrivant keeps one from discriminating btwn figures of arrivant > the dead, the revenant (the ghost, he or she that returns)
A.linkedContent: border of absolute arrivant keeps one from discriminating btwn figures of arrivant > the dead, the revenant (the ghost, he or she that returns)

A.content: Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)

A.content: for Derrida, in contrast to Heidegger [Freud & Levinas too?], mourning, revenance, spectrality, living-on, surviving: non-derivable categories or non-reducible derivations
A.linkedContent: for Derrida, in contrast to Heidegger [Freud & Levinas too?], mourning, revenance, spectrality, living-on, surviving: non-derivable categories or non-reducible derivations

A.content: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage
A.linkedContent: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage

SH.content: conventional forms of dating (charts, coded signs, spatiotemporal plottings, clocks,  calendar) assign, consign, absolute singularity, must mark themselves off from themselves, a fatally equivocal power that enunciates the possibility of recurrence > not absolute recurrence (i.e. of the one time of circumcision/birth) but spectral recurrence of that which never will return
SH.linkedContent: conventional forms of dating (charts, coded signs, spatiotemporal plottings, clocks, calendar) assign, consign, absolute singularity, must mark themselves off from themselves, a fatally equivocal power that enunciates the possibility of recurrence > not absolute recurrence (i.e. of the one time of circumcision/birth) but spectral recurrence of that which never will return

SH.content: 13th of February becomes its own revenant each year
SH.linkedContent: 13th of February becomes its own revenant each year

SH.content: uniqueness of every hour has its sister, its own, the same, its other revenant
SH.linkedContent: uniqueness of every hour has its sister, its own, the same, its other revenant

F.content: ghost effect (ghost that comes haunting from someone else’s crypt, heterocryptography) ≠ crypt effect (foreigner incorporated in crypt of Self) > la revenance n’est pas un retour du refoulé ——“ventroliquist” speaks from topography w/in self or from foreign/parental topography
F.linkedContent: ghost effect (ghost that comes haunting from someone else’s crypt, heterocryptography) ≠ crypt effect (foreigner incorporated in crypt of Self) > la revenance n’est pas un retour du refoulé ——“ventroliquist” speaks from topography w/in self or from foreign/parental topography

FWT.content: Marx’s critique of ideology is a critique of the revenant > reproduces panic fear of spectrality, pursues, distances himself from, chases (away) the ghost
FWT.linkedContent: Marx’s critique of ideology is a critique of the revenant > reproduces panic fear of spectrality, pursues, distances himself from, chases (away) the ghost

FWT.content: revenant different from specter/ghost (latter have horizons, are visible, come into light); revenant—think event & haunting together; revenant “almost” merges w/ trace itself
FWT.linkedContent: revenant different from specter/ghost (latter have horizons, are visible, come into light); revenant—think event & haunting together; revenant “almost” merges w/ trace itself

P.content: art forms only one of the circles in the great circle of Geist, revenant (circle of art, circle of religion, circle of philosophy)
P.linkedContent: art forms only one of the circles in the great circle of Geist, revenant (circle of art, circle of religion, circle of philosophy)

DPi.content: Socrates’ death: katēgoria (accusation), a theological one: he introduced new demons (hetera de daimonia kaina), daimonia sometimes gods but also lesser ones, revenants
DPi.linkedContent: Socrates’ death: katēgoria (accusation), a theological one: he introduced new demons (hetera de daimonia kaina), daimonia sometimes gods but also lesser ones, revenants

REST.content: what revenue, what surplus value is unleashed, what ghost step (pas de revenant) still comes to haunt the shoe’s in their painting truth (the annulment of their use-value, their out-of-service dereliction)? [revenue & revenant]
REST.linkedContent: what revenue, what surplus value is unleashed, what ghost step (pas de revenant) still comes to haunt the shoe’s in their painting truth (the annulment of their use-value, their out-of-service dereliction)? [revenue & revenant]

REST.content: are they (the shoes) haunted by some ghost or la revenance itself
REST.linkedContent: are they (the shoes) haunted by some ghost or la revenance itself

REST.content: Shapiro’s restitution brings a ghost back alive to a dead man, mais revenant, revenant vivant au mort: dès lors vivant, lui-même revenant, who is himself then a ghost returning, “personal object” coming back to the ghost (revenant au revenant)
REST.linkedContent: Shapiro’s restitution brings a ghost back alive to a dead man, mais revenant, revenant vivant au mort: dès lors vivant, lui-même revenant, who is himself then a ghost returning, “personal object” coming back to the ghost (revenant au revenant)

REST.content: sacrifice in memory of another dead man, who [Goldstein] remains stony, like his name, mais revient aussi, comme un revenant, grâce au don de ce revenant [dead bury the dead?]
REST.linkedContent: sacrifice in memory of another dead man, who [Goldstein] remains stony, like his name, mais revient aussi, comme un revenant, grâce au don de ce revenant [dead bury the dead?]

REST.content: shoe, like letter, does not always arrive at its destination: condition of revenance [Derrida replaces “letter” w/ “shoe,” quoting a passage from FV]
REST.linkedContent: shoe, like letter, does not always arrive at its destination: condition of revenance [Derrida replaces “letter” w/ “shoe,” quoting a passage from FV]

REST.content: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself
REST.linkedContent: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself

REST.content: “to suicide” someone —make him come back (le faire revenir) as a ghost (fantôme) or make him stay (le faire rester) as a ghost, où il est, en somme assez bien enterré, ne disposant plus que de ses pas? > pas de revenant, pas de nom [don’t let the dead bury the dead]
REST.linkedContent: “to suicide” someone —make him come back (le faire revenir) as a ghost (fantôme) or make him stay (le faire rester) as a ghost, où il est, en somme assez bien enterré, ne disposant plus que de ses pas? > pas de revenant, pas de nom [don’t let the dead bury the dead]

HLP.content: fabulous, phantasma, return of some specter: apparition of specter, vision of phantom, phenomenon of the revenant
HLP.linkedContent: fabulous, phantasma, return of some specter: apparition of specter, vision of phantom, phenomenon of the revenant

HLP.content: fable & phantasm do not belong to true or false
HLP.linkedContent: fable & phantasm do not belong to true or false

HLP.content: irreducible species of simulacrum, penumbral light [cf. FK p. 55 desert as nocturnal light] of a virtuality, neither being nor nothingness (no ontology/mimetology could account for it)
HLP.linkedContent: irreducible species of simulacrum, penumbral light [cf. FK p. 55 desert as nocturnal light] of a virtuality, neither being nor nothingness (no ontology/mimetology could account for it)

WAP.content: people haven’t noticed how often the dead return
WAP.linkedContent: people haven’t noticed how often the dead return

PSSS.content: these revenants must haunt our debates [Joshua Jung, Moses Freud] > cruel destiny of a proper name
PSSS.linkedContent: these revenants must haunt our debates [Joshua Jung, Moses Freud] > cruel destiny of a proper name

EL.content: [re: Scholem’s letter] a revenant proclaims terrifying return of a ghost
EL.linkedContent: [re: Scholem’s letter] a revenant proclaims terrifying return of a ghost

EL.content: for Scholem, not only a loss of sacred language but its revenance in form of revenge
EL.linkedContent: for Scholem, not only a loss of sacred language but its revenance in form of revenge

EL.content: return, repetition, revenance, the re- in language, as language insofar as it inaugurates possibility of revenge in language
EL.linkedContent: return, repetition, revenance, the re- in language, as language insofar as it inaugurates possibility of revenge in language

EL.content: for Scholem, Sprache ist Namen, being of language resides in name, not in substantive but nominal, in power of naming (verbs were once names) > Derrida (via an internal reading) adds: must be a spectral haunting, there is a specter because there’s language, language can haunt because names haunt (neither present/absent) our sentences, language summons (convoque)—category of spectral revenant (not a flower of rhetoric) figures a beyond oppositional ontologic or dialectic of presence/absence
EL.linkedContent: for Scholem, Sprache ist Namen, being of language resides in name, not in substantive but nominal, in power of naming (verbs were once names) > Derrida (via an internal reading) adds: must be a spectral haunting, there is a specter because there’s language, language can haunt because names haunt (neither present/absent) our sentences, language summons (convoque)—category of spectral revenant (not a flower of rhetoric) figures a beyond oppositional ontologic or dialectic of presence/absence

EL.content: a dynamis, enveloped virtuality, a power of language, quasi-autonomous [that of the name]
EL.linkedContent: a dynamis, enveloped virtuality, a power of language, quasi-autonomous [that of the name]

HST.content: Tupinamba give tearful welcome: stranger hailed as revenant; hôte as ghost (spirit or revenant, holy spirit)
HST.linkedContent: Tupinamba give tearful welcome: stranger hailed as revenant; hôte as ghost (spirit or revenant, holy spirit)

PPT.content: when one unlaces (or considers the lacing), one looks for revenue (return or investment) or revenant that comes back
PPT.linkedContent: when one unlaces (or considers the lacing), one looks for revenue (return or investment) or revenant that comes back

C.content: revenant—127 times, what of the remains is being put into figures (chiffré) in this way?
C.linkedContent: revenant—127 times, what of the remains is being put into figures (chiffré) in this way?

TN.content: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung

TN.content: intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)
TN.linkedContent: intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)

SPEC.content: if one’s [intellectual, re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche] debt is always another’s, one is acquitted and guilty in advance? comment spéculer sur la dette d’un autre à soi revenant (amounting to, coming back to oneself)?
SPEC.linkedContent: if one’s [intellectual, re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche] debt is always another’s, one is acquitted and guilty in advance? comment spéculer sur la dette d’un autre à soi revenant (amounting to, coming back to oneself)?

SPEC.content: Freud’s speculation does not construct itself by itself like Hegel’s: however concerned w/ revenants, ne revient pas sur lui-même
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s speculation does not construct itself by itself like Hegel’s: however concerned w/ revenants, ne revient pas sur lui-même

SPEC.content: PP always revient to itself, haunted by tout autre, retour never “acquits” speculation of PP
SPEC.linkedContent: PP always revient to itself, haunted by tout autre, retour never “acquits” speculation of PP

SPEC.content: PP cannot be contradicted (contredit); Freud confirms PP in its absolute sovereignty
SPEC.linkedContent: PP cannot be contradicted (contredit); Freud confirms PP in its absolute sovereignty

SPEC.content: Freud his own grandson? put PP in question—Freud makes hypothesis of beyond [the PP] come back (revenir) only to dismiss (congédier) it again, that which comes back (revient) hasn’t truly come back (revenu) > only passed by in specter of its presence
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud his own grandson? put PP in question—Freud makes hypothesis of beyond [the PP] come back (revenir) only to dismiss (congédier) it again, that which comes back (revient) hasn’t truly come back (revenu) > only passed by in specter of its presence

SPEC.content: [grandson & son want each other to understand] but we know what a tautology can bring back by gushing over (peut faire revenir en dégorgeant)
SPEC.linkedContent: [grandson & son want each other to understand] but we know what a tautology can bring back by gushing over (peut faire revenir en dégorgeant)

SPEC.content: for Freud, in game of fort/da, the greatest pleasure is the re-turn (re-venir), Wiederkommen: yet, again becoming revenant, [spool] must be thrown away again > [Freud, the game] speculates on the return (retour): au départ de ce qui se doit de revenir
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, in game of fort/da, the greatest pleasure is the re-turn (re-venir), Wiederkommen: yet, again becoming revenant, [spool] must be thrown away again > [Freud, the game] speculates on the return (retour): au départ de ce qui se doit de revenir

SPEC.content: what binds (lie) game to itself is re- of return, the returned or the returning (le revenu ou le revenant), revenance orders entire teleology, can be handed over to PP
SPEC.linkedContent: what binds (lie) game to itself is re- of return, the returned or the returning (le revenu ou le revenant), revenance orders entire teleology, can be handed over to PP

SPEC.content: reappearance as a moment of the couple disappearance/reappearance, return to itself of return: greatest pleasure
SPEC.linkedContent: reappearance as a moment of the couple disappearance/reappearance, return to itself of return: greatest pleasure

SPEC.content: demon, revenance which repeats its entrance, revient w/out having been called by PP > like Socrates’ demon, which made everyone write, this automaton produces effects of ventriloquism, w/out origin, emission, addressee, tele w/out telos
SPEC.linkedContent: demon, revenance which repeats its entrance, revient w/out having been called by PP > like Socrates’ demon, which made everyone write, this automaton produces effects of ventriloquism, w/out origin, emission, addressee, tele w/out telos

SPEC.content: demon doesn’t obey master PP, visitation not confined to neurosis, Freud insists on apparent passivity of persons visited
SPEC.linkedContent: demon doesn’t obey master PP, visitation not confined to neurosis, Freud insists on apparent passivity of persons visited

SPEC.content: demonic, archive of its own demon: undissolved transference, like unpaid debt of inheritance, one can begin an inheritance thus: laissée en sommeil, la menace ainsi enkystée [pocket]
SPEC.linkedContent: demonic, archive of its own demon: undissolved transference, like unpaid debt of inheritance, one can begin an inheritance thus: laissée en sommeil, la menace ainsi enkystée [pocket]

SPEC.content: detour expanding immeasurably: Umweg of 1st Chapter [re: Freud’s Beyond…] secondary to absolute/unconditional Umweg > pas de détour always leads back to death, not a question of going (aller) but of coming back (revenir)—this is the passage
SPEC.linkedContent: detour expanding immeasurably: Umweg of 1st Chapter [re: Freud’s Beyond…] secondary to absolute/unconditional Umweg > pas de détour always leads back to death, not a question of going (aller) but of coming back (revenir)—this is the passage

SPEC.content: no one demands to know what devil thinks dans son for intérieur, Freud can think the devil w/out putting himself on the devil’s side (no written promise/contract w/ devil)
SPEC.linkedContent: no one demands to know what devil thinks dans son for intérieur, Freud can think the devil w/out putting himself on the devil’s side (no written promise/contract w/ devil)
